f0.description:
This base font-size is expressed in pixels (px) for min. viewport.


A base font-size is the starting point for the text content on a web page. It acts as a reference for determining the sizes of all other fonts. It is commonly expressed in pixels (px) or relative units such as percentages (%).

This base font-size is expressed in pixels (px) for max. viewport.

body.description:
Base styles define the foundational type size within an application. Suitable for the main content area or body of a user interface.

h1.description:
Suitable for product-based UI designs such as panels, cards, and menus.
The <h1> tag is commonly used to display the main title on a webpage.
Type scaling applied.

h2.description:
Suitable for product-based UI designs such as panels, cards, and menus. 
The <h2> tag is commonly used as subheadings to organize and structure the content within a webpage or section.
